title: GitLab for Jira app: Add instructions/guidance step to self-managed setup flow
description:
## Description
During the installation flow for the `GitLab for Jira app`, there are many manual steps required by users that may be challenging. Until we are able to automate and improve the UX for this flow (in a future follow-up), we want to supply additional context to users going through this process.

At minimum, this should include a link to our docs with some explanation or high level steps.

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/jira/connect-app.html#connect-the-gitlabcom-for-jira-cloud-app-for-self-managed-instances

Ideally, we could embed a video walkthrough showing users how to complete the setup.

## Design

![image](/uploads/dbffd9d32251251103922cb90529a131/image.png)

See [wireframes in Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/aHbl44rMsoTkUYAw8uHqbY/Jira-oauth?node-id=35%3A4905&t=C5GiJKR63Jdd8HXZ-0).

epic.title: Self-managed support extended to GitLab for Jira app

title: Draft: Java Spring Boot: End-user documentation
API Discovery: Java Spring Boot: Initial implementation
description:
### Context

See https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9253

### Goal

A tool that can be included into a pipeline via a template (similar to other security products) which, given a path to a Spring Boot Executable Jar, will produce an OpenAPI document describing the endpoints in that jar, which is saved as an artifact.

### Criteria

This initial implementation will target the lowest versions we intend to support, which will make it easier to support later versions due to backward compatibility; or the easiest to implement scenario we intend to support where version doesn't apply.

- Java 8 (as the default Java version available on the runner)
- Spring Boot 2.0.9
- [Spring Boot Executable Jar](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/html/executable-jar.html#appendix.executable-jar.nested-jars.jar-structure)
- Built with Gradle + Spring Boot plugin

### Implementation

- [ ] Java Executable  
See spike code at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/api-discovery-src/-/tree/spike-springdoc-offline
    - [ ] Read location of jar file from environment variable, include it in classpath
    - [ ] Start a Spring context loading Spring Boot and SpringDoc configurations
    - [ ] Perform a component scan, excluding known non-user packages (Spring Boot, SpringDoc, GitLab, etc), to find controller beans
    - [ ] Use SpringDoc to generate OpenAPI doc based on registered beans
- [ ] Pipeline
    - [ ] Builds executable
    - [ ] Runs tests
    - [ ] Pushes executable to staging registry
- [ ] Template
    - [ ] Fetches executable from (staging) registry
    - [ ] Runs executable
- [ ] Testing
    - [ ] Unit tests
    - [ ] Scenario test:
        - [ ] Build sample target jar
        - [ ] Run API discovery
        - [ ] Assert the resulting doc
    - [ ] Acceptance test:
        - [ ] Include template in pipeline
        - [ ] Run included job
        - [ ] Assert doc as artifact
- [ ] Developer Documentation  
This initial implementation will not attempt to create end-user documentation, since it might well have to change considerably before the product is ready to be released. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/382774+
    - [ ] Contributing, including local setup and development
    - [ ] Testing strategy

title: Migrate FIPS containers to UBI9
description:
### Problem

API Security ships two containers regular and FIPS. The FIPS container is based on RedHat's UBI base images, currently version 8. Secure recently received authorization to use UBI v9, a more recent version of UBI. This allows using a base image that is more in line with our regular Alpine version.

Since UBI makes no distinction between point releases, the latest v9 minimal image can be used.

### Proposal

1. [ ] Review UBI9 .NET dockerfile to identify any new configuration that is needed. Context: The UBI .NET image isn't based on ubi-minimal, so we have created our own based on the RedHat's dockerfile.
   1. https://catalog.redhat.com/software/containers/rhel8/dotnet-60-runtime/6182ef98c0d15aff4912fdae?container-tabs=dockerfile 
1. [ ] Create a `Dockerfile-ubi9-dotnet-60-runtime` image based on `Dockerfile-ubi82-dotnet-60-runtime` and the RedHat UBI9 .NET dockerfile.
1. [ ] Remove `Dockerfile-ubi82-dotnet-60-runtime`
1. [ ] Update `Dockerfile-base-fips` to:
   1. [ ] Use `Dockerfile-ubi9-dotnet-60-runtime`
   1. [ ] Update `microdnf` RUN statements to use `ubi-9-os` and `ubi-9-appstream`
   1. [ ] Update python check to 3.9
1. [ ] Update `docker-compose.python.py36.yml` to `docker-compose.python.py39.yml`
1. [ ] Update `docker-compose.worker-entry_py36.yml` to `docker-compose.worker-entry_py39.yml`
1. [ ] Update `builds/tests_int_worker-entry_py36`
1. [ ] Update `builds/tests_unit_py36`
1. [ ] Update `web/Test/Containers/scripts/run_python.sh`
1. [ ] Verify pipelines works
1. [ ] Verify scheduled pipeline works
1. [ ] Notify @mikeeddington to release a new container and perform compliance review

title: Clean up `use_introspect_parser` feature flag related logic
description:
## Why are we doing this work

This issue is to clean up the logic related to the `use_introspect_parser` feature flag as it's been enabled by default in %"15.6".

## Relevant links

- FF rollout issue: #381789+
- FF implemented by: !103013+

## Implementation plan

- [x] Run `/chatops run feature delete use_introspect_parser --dev --staging --staging-ref --production` to delete the FF
- [x] ~backend Remove the `use_introspect_parser` FF-related logic from `ee/lib/ee/gitlab/ci/parsers/security/common.rb` to always use `introspect_parser`. Basically removing the `report_data` from this EE module and adding the `introspect_parser` to the CE module should be enough.
- [x] ~backend Remove the FF definition from the codebase.

title: [MR Widget V2] Remove bold emphasis from `no new` in security reports
description:
## Summary

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/103485#note_1169575140 for more information.

Recently a new MR was introduced to remove the bold emphasis from the `new` string in the MR Security Reports.

This is the text that is being referred to: 

![image](/uploads/ee6b0c6d3b43d8264f09c97c4f5c3421/image.png)

This MR should add the same functionality to V2. 

## Implementation plan

- [ ] `ee/app/assets/javascripts/vue_merge_request_widget/extensions/security_reports/i18n.js:28` contains the translation. Update it to remove the bold text.

## Verification steps 

- [ ] [Follow the steps](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/104203) to enable this feature locally.
- [ ] Check that the `no new` text in the security reports MR Widget is not bold

title: Rename Ci::AfterRequeueJobService class
description:
## Problem

After the changes in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/104012/diffs#743206db9c9cc807d199ed10557cae1f4ba1660a_70_67 we now run `AfterRequeueJobService` before processing the pipeline which eventually will enqueue any jobs.

```ruby
Ci::AfterRequeueJobService.new(project, current_user).execute(job)
Ci::PipelineCreation::StartPipelineService.new(job.pipeline).execute
```

With this change, the name `AfterRequeueJobService` is no longer accurate because we can actually run the service before we enqueue jobs.

## Solution

Rename the service class. Some ideas:

- `Ci::ResetSubsequentJobsService`
- `Ci::ActivateSubsequentJobsService`
- `Ci::ResetSkippedJobsService`

title: [MR Widget V2] Fix button styling issues
description:
Original comment: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/378886#note_1172261123

The action button has some rendering issues:

1. It's not vertically centered with the `?` icon to the left of it, and sits a bit higher (zoomed in to exaggerate the effect). This is not due to the button itself, but rather because the `?` icon is not centered within its container:

|Not vertically centered with `?` icon|`?` icon is not centered within its container|
|-|-|
|![ksnip_20221115-000540](/uploads/25bc1c8f50128449dc40eddf6ba4603c/ksnip_20221115-000540.png)|![ksnip_20221115-001502](/uploads/f8cdcdd0c2ec2c9f743c3bc234c96483/ksnip_20221115-001502.png)|

2. The icon is not horizontally centered within the hover background, and sits a bit to the left. This is because the icon SVG has a right margin:

|Icon not horizontally centered within its container|Icon SVG has right margin|
|-|-|
|![ksnip_20221115-000735](/uploads/1ae4148910b0e7320111bf53332f85f4/ksnip_20221115-000735.png)|![ksnip_20221115-001638](/uploads/e621f89ae1b48bd2774b8d2692644e45/ksnip_20221115-001638.png)|

3. This one is more personal opinion, but the vertical padding is 4px, which looks unbalanced (vertical padding is too small compared to the horizontal padding). Looking at some of the other icons in the page (like the ones in the header) the vertical padding is 6px, which looks a more balanced when applied to the download icon:

|4px vertical padding|6px vertical padding|
|-|-|
|![ksnip_20221115-001948](/uploads/21acbc59384abcddc5046e55cde3049b/ksnip_20221115-001948.png)|![ksnip_20221115-001931](/uploads/d380579597b3ab4ae47cd9988f52ac1e/ksnip_20221115-001931.png)|


## Verification steps

- [ ] Go to https://gitlab.com/svedova/security-reports/-/merge_requests/1
- [ ] Expand the security reports widget
- [ ] Check that icons are rendering without any styling issues

epic.title: [MR Widget] V2

title: the endpoint /job/allowed_agents does not populate the fields
description:
### Summary The API output of the `/job/allowed_agents` call does not include all the information that should be returned. (more details in examples). For reference - [GitLab Docs output](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/jobs.html#get-gitlab-agent-by-ci_job_token). ### Steps to reproduce GitLab 15.6 output:
Click to expand ```json { "allowed_agents": [ { "id": 4143, "config_project": { "id": 21222450, "description": null, "name": "agent1-test", "name_with_namespace": "Name with namespace here", "path": "agent1-test", "path_with_namespace": "name-with/namespace/here", "created_at": "2022-01-18T15:06:41.422Z" }, "configuration": {} } ], "job": { "id": 2223480651 }, "pipeline": { "id": 774876553 }, "project": { "id": 21068801, "groups": [ { "id": 186824 }, { "id": 146791 }, { "id": 25024 } ] }, ... ```
GitLab 14.0 output:
Click to expand ```json { "allowed_agents": [], "job": { "id": 3, "name": "test1", "stage": "test", "project_id": 4, "project_name": "balerion" }, "pipeline": { "id": 3, "project_id": 4, "sha": "67b2dfb250e5eb02c48420dad524ca65d01cdc99", "ref": "master", "status": "running", "created_at": "2022-11-15T09:10:40.198Z", "updated_at": "2022-11-15T09:10:47.267Z", "web_url": "https://domain.com/naboo/balerion/-/pipelines/3" }, "project": { "id": 4, "description": "The HDD monitor is down, parse the multi-byte interface so we can index the TCP matrix!", "name": "balerion", "name_with_namespace": "Naboo / balerion", "path": "balerion", "path_with_namespace": "naboo/balerion", "created_at": "2022-11-15T08:34:42.947Z" }, ... } ```
### Example Project https://gitlab.com/gitlab-gold/faleksic-tests/private-group/ci-testing-private/-/jobs/3323921774 (Internal only) ### What is the current *bug* behavior? The fields are not expanded and only contain the IDs. ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Fields are populated. ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots My understanding is that the API endpoint changed with the [Move API CI related classes under Ci namespace](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/66263) merge request. The endpoint changed from [v14.0.0-ee GET '/allowed_agents'](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/v14.0.0-ee/ee/lib/ee/api/jobs.rb#L14-30) to [v14.6.0-ee GET '/allowed_agents'](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/v14.6.0-ee/lib/api/ci/jobs.rb#L185-212). ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Proposal The API was previously returning too much data. We need to update the ~documentation to reflect the current responses.

title: Group Sync fails when a user has an existing group access request
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->
When a user has an existing [group access request](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/manage.html#request-access-to-a-group) and authenticates via SAML with [Group Sync](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/saml_sso/group_sync.html) the `GroupSamlGroupSyncWorker` fails with an `Gitlab::Access::AccessDeniedError`.


### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->
Using a group with SAML + group sync enabled:
* Request access to a group
* Re-authenticate via SAML

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->
Due to the error, it fails to process group links for the user.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->
Process the group links as expected.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

<!-- Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output, logs, and code
 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->
https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/4031145/
